intro: Rauvolfia kamarora, commonly known as the Kamarora roseroot, is a tropical climbing plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers followed by red or orange berries. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ethnobotanical research.
